title: A to_int_checked fn to cast floats to integers

labels.name: T-libs-api
labels.description: Relevant to the library API team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: C-feature-request
labels.description: Category: A feature request, i.e: not implemented / a PR.

body:
At the moment there are two ways to cast floats: `as` and `to_int_unchecked`. I am curious if there are plans to add more ways to cast floats to integers.

Integer arithmetic has explicit methods like `checked_add`, `overflowing_add`, etc. The compiler chooses appropriate operator to use instead of implicit `+` according to Debug/Release mode (or more specifically to -C overflow-checks=on|off flag).

However `float as integer` uses exactly one version of cast to integer, saturating cast. Are there plans to add explicit `to_int_saturating`, additional `to_int_checked` and to call them in implicit `as` convertation according to `overflow-checks` flag?

I would expect `as` to use `to_int_saturating` in `overflow-checks=off` and to use `to_int_checked` otherwise which would panic if the result did not fit the target type.
